concept.title: Legacy Code Manager
concept.shortdesc: Legacy Code Manager provides access to saved code archives and other libraries that are not actively being developed.

conbody.p: Analytics > Admin > Code Manager. There is a link to the legacy code manager below the table.

section.title: Legacy Code Manager Page Descriptions
section.p: The following table describes the fields and options you use to generate code.

entry.p: The report suite specified in the Code Manager is used to populate the s_account variable in the JavaScript file. If you plan to use a single JavaScript file across multiple properties, declare the s_account variable on the HTML page rather than in the JavaScript file. For more information about this option, contact an Adobe representative.

Specifies the desired character-encoding format for the generated code. Ensure that setting matches the character encoding on your website. Selecting the wrong character encoding can cause permanent data loss because text is improperly converted upon receipt. The character encoding drop-down populates the charSet called, which is used by Adobe's data collection servers to translate any characters into UTF-8 for storage. Adobe supports all character sets that can be converted to UTF-8.
entry.note: An error in the character encoding can cause permanent loss of data, because the text will be improperly converted when received. Please select the correct character encoding of your web site.
entry.p: If your web site(s) use multiple character encoding, you can dynamically change the value of the charSet variable by declaring on your HTML file. Use Search for Character Encodings option to see all supported character encoding. Note that the character set in use on your site may have a different name than the corresponding character set listed in this tool.

Specifies the currency to use for conversion from the transaction currency to the base currency of your web site. The currency is the currency in which data is stored in reporting. All currency amounts are converted from the transaction currency to the base currency upon receipt of the data, based on the current conversion rate.

The Currency drop-down is used to populate the currencyCode JavaScript variable. If your site allows transactions in multiple currencies, you can declare the currencyCode variable dynamically on your HTML page rather than in the JavaScript file.

entry.wintitle: Number of periods in domain name

entry.p: Specify the number of periods in your website's domain name. For example, www.acme.com = 2 periods; www.acme.co.uk = 3 periods.
Select to generate code using secure HTTP (SSL) instead of standard HTTP.
A name for the code archive.
(Optional) A detailed description of the code in the archive. This field has a 255 character limit.

section.title: Save Tracking Code Descriptions
section.p: When you generate code, you can archive it on the Code Manager page.

The archived code table displays the archive name, description, creation date, and the actual code in text format. The archive lets you securely store code versions in case you need them in the future.
The following table describes the fields and options you use to archive code.

entry.p: A name for the code archive.
(Optional) A detailed description of the code in the archive. This field has a 255 character limit.
